sub_title: Senior Software Engineer | Backend | .NET Core | C# | WPF | MVVM | ASP.NET MVC | Web API | Unity 3D | Software Architecture | Mentor
summary:
👉 Summary:
.NET / C# backend software engineer (web + desktop) with mentoring, OOP, SOLID, MVC, MVVM, Big-O, Git, design patterns, and software testing experiences.

💼 Developer profile:
– architecture and technical work are my favorite and strongest (goal: Software Architect/Tech Lead) over routine feature development
– looking for challenges to improve my skills and competences
– looking for innovations over just utilizing a legacy code
– patient, empathetic, top contributor but I have dignity and temper especially against people who claim they "know everything better than others" 🔥

✔️ My hobby is cooking, sci-fi, astrophysics, gaming, RPG, comics, books, and spending time on my private projects. Not a fan of long meetings.

🌍 Region preferences*:
1st (Eurozone): France, Spain, Italy
2nd (Scandinavia): Sweden / Denmark / Norway
3rd (English): Canada, Australia / New Zealand

❌ Not interested:
*Working in countries (after moving out) where I already lived, dress code, open spaces (chicken coop), commuting more than 45 minutes, aggressive and rival environment, corpo-rat mindset, non-English-speaking companies, tiny/local companies.

🏆 Goals:
– Business tourist + English-speaking diverse environment
– Modern technologies with perspective: ML, AI, IoT, Big Data
– Software Architect / Tech Lead

=====
SKILLS:
=====

💾 Backend (domain)⭐️:
– Languages: C#
– Paradigms: object-oriented, procedural, functional
– Architectures: MVC, MVVM, DI, DDD, REST, microservices
– Testing: unit tests (NUnit, MSTest2), integration tests, TDD, mocking, code coverage
– Frameworks: .NET Framework / Core, .NET 6, ASP.NET MVC,
– Other: LINQ, RegEx, design patterns, SOLID, Big-O, CI/CD. Markdown, UML
– Tools: ReSharper, DotCover, DotMemory,

🔑 Databases:
– Languages: SQL, T-SQL
– DB: Microsoft SQL Server, SQLite
– ORM: Entity Framework, SQLite4Unity3D

📡 Version Control System:
– Git⭐️ (CLI + GUI), MS TFVC
– MS TFS, Azure DevOps, GitLab, GitHub

🎮 GameDev⭐️:
– Engines: Unity Engine 3D

🌼 Frontend:
– Languages: JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, XAML
– Libraries: jQuery, AJAX
– Frameworks: Bootstrap
– Template engines: ASP.NET Razor, WPF
– Other: JSON, XML, LibMan

🍒 Supporting languages:
– Java, Python

– Personality / soft skills:
🚩 Ambitious; proven mentoring and team-leading skills
👥 Communicative, co-op, assertive, dark sense of humor
⚡️ Dynamic, proactive, self-driven & initiative attitude
📋 Good organization of work, planning, independence
⌚️ Straightforwardness, reliability, perseverance, patience
🔍 Accuracy, bit neurotic detail-oriented mindset, analytical

projects.title: Proxima Majoris: The Steel Thieves (indie game)
projects.description:
"Proxima Majoris: The Steel Thieves" is the Triple-I, tactical SciFi survival horror game.
✸ Setting: dirty cyberpunk, future-retro, apocalypse (ruined world), dangerous space, wormholes.
✸ Inspirations: old-school '80 manner, space novels, old movies ("The Thing", "Alien", "Mad Max").
✸ Gameplay: base-building Real Time Strategy (RTS), isometric survival horror with elements of social management. Challenges and story are basing on scientifically accurate astrophysics, astrogeology, astrobiology, medicine, psychology, engineering and the astonishing dose of futurism, with strong elements of Role Playing Game (RPG), difficulty moral choices, and surprising – literally breathtaking story, around the dangerous reality of extraterrestrial planets and cosmic conditions.
✸ MVP: isometric cyberpunk horror, limited field of view, overwhelming amount and strength of opponent forces, moral relativism, atmospheric dark ambient & retro wave music, strange noises, very challenging difficulty level, high quality & precision, scientifically-close story and playable realism.

Experienced Software Developer at GFT Technologies

projects.title: Migration from TFVS to Git for Baker Hughes (CTC)
projects.description:
I proposed and kicked off the initiative to migrate two large enterprise business products (systems) from centralized Microsoft's Team Foundation Version Control System into the distributed Git version control system.

The main goal was to follow a more modern, flexible, and powerful solution on how to deliver a better quality of products and how to make the life of software engineers easier and their workflow more efficient (code development workflow, faster deployment, code quality (review), and security improvements). As a result, we achieved a significant improvement during the deployment of the final business products for two major flagship projects maintained by Baker Hughes.

The project was realized mainly for facilities in Celle (Germany) and Kochi (India), but they also affected employees at Houston, TX (USA), and Aberdeen (Scotland).

I participated in establishing branch policies, workflow for further contributions and code review processes, as well as helping DevOps teams during refinement compliance agreements before introducing a new system on production. I managed to propose technical solutions on how to migrate History of commitments from TFVC to Git and, finally, prepared knowledge transfer materials and practical exercises to train all engaged employees.

During the last "implementation" phase, I hosted 3 large workshop sessions (between 4 to 7 hours) - stationary (Germany) and remotely (Kochi / COVID-19) for approx. 120 total number of participants. Workshops were dedicated to share good practices, GitFlow, nomenclature, differences, and similarities between two systems, commands and operations, as well as basic and intermediate Git concepts. Every aspect of the content was covered with live examples, exercises (prepared earlier), and real case scenarios to visualize real strategies and decisions.

Human Resources Manager at GUESS?, Inc.

profile_positions.description: Lead .NET / C# role in the backend part of the sizeable governmental initiative "Notify NL" - connecting citizens of The Netherlands with their municipalities and the government. Notify NL is a communication platform to inform subscribers about the outcomes of the municipal or governmental processes (issued documents, terms and dates, results of audits, decisions, etc.). The system can send SMS text messages or emails to citizens who wish to be informed about the progress of their administrative cases.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Developer

profile_positions.description:
Summary:
I am a founder and the leading role in my hobby game dev project ("Proxima Majoris: The Steel Thieves"), authored by an independent international (European-Asian) group of voluntary collaborators and friends (Hydra Dev Studio – since 2017) which on the different phases of development consists or consisted game developers and artists (music, SFX, 3D).

As the main author (since 2012), I was responsible for thinking out the base idea of the game, preparing the fundaments of the game universe, story, GDD, mechanics, character design, level design, conceptual work, research, posting collaboration notes (sort of recruitment), and creative writing (story, quests, dialogues).

🏆 I decided to include this project in my Resume because of the overall amount of time spent on it, the ambitious and quite unusual scale of the effort (inviting people from around the world), and all kinds of experiences I gained during the duration of this project (software developer, Unity 3D, designer, Product Owner, Scrum Master, Team Leader, mentor, recruiter, Hiring Manager). Proxima Majoris is my private non-commercial initiative, combining different aspects of the software development cycle and a neverending deep-diving journey into the process of creation - a hobby, independent PC game.

About the game:
"Proxima Majoris" is a survival-horror, science fiction game, settled around base building and storytelling MVP. We are focusing on social interactions between spaceship crew members; forcing the player to make hard, painful choices; making the game overwhelmingly difficult, and offering the player a lot of space novel Sci-Fi stories. The game is stylized to old-school isometric games such as Baldur's Gate, Planescape Torment, Fallout, Arcanum, Jagged Alliance 2, and StarCraft, as well as retro movies/cyberpunk animes from the '80s & '90s: The Thing, Alien, Blade Runner, Mad Max, Akira, Ghost in the Shell, Armitage III.
profile_positions.title: Author / Product Owner / Team Leader

profile_positions.description:
NOTE: Continuation of the contract from 2019-2020 📃

Backend .NET / C# Senior Software Engineer at Baker Hughes Reservoir Software B.V. (Delft, The Netherlands).

🏆 Company profile:
Baker Hughes is one of the largest Oil and Gas Services companies (delivering services, knowledge, and equipment to the largest Oil and Gas companies such as Shell, BP, Saudi Aramco, etc). Placed among the top 3 global leaders in this industry on Earth (next to Halliburton and Schlumberger), listed on NASDAQ and S&P 500. Formerly merged with General Electric as "Baker Hughes, a GE company".

Summary:
The "Radiant" project in Delft is an initiative based on a collaboration between Baker Hughes and Shell companies. The project aims to develop and enhance the JewelSuite (TM) application used for 3D and 2D subsurface modeling of geological structures. The application is used by geologists, geoengineers, cartographers, and petroleum companies worldwide. JewelSuite can be found in Microsoft Azure Marketplace.

Responsibilities:
– Improvement of architecture (Domain-Driven Development (DDD), Event-Driven Development (EDD), software design patterns, SOLID, memory leaks, refactoring, simplifying the code, and introducing API)
– Improvement of performance (algorithms, Big-O)
– Improvement of code quality and standards (MSDN, ReSharper, SonarQube, Azure DevOps sanity checks, C# unit tests, SpecFlow integration tests, documentation)
– Implementing new functionalities (C# backend + WPF frontend, UX adjustments)
– Improving team workflow (automation batch scripts, API Generator tool)
– Training, workshops, mentoring, knowledge sharing
– Maintenance and bug fixing

Technologies:
– .NET Framework, .NET Core 3.1, .NET Standard 2.0, C# 9+, WPF, XAML, Mocking frameworks (Moq), unit testing (MS Test 2), TDD, SkiaSharp (vector graphic), Git, Azure DevOps, SonarQube, Markdown.

Methodologies/frameworks:
– Agile SCRUM, Kanban
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
I am including this biographical fact only for record purposes,
❌ I am not planning to look for Product Owner job offers. 💼

The main reason to start learning more about the Product Owner position was to establish a team working together on my indie science-fiction RTS/RPG game project. After some time, from someone who gathered people around and kicked off the main initiative, I evolved into an official PO in our team.
Later, I was using this experience to help other teams in other companies (incl. Citi, Baker Hughes) as an unofficial technical PO, interim PO, or PO deputy.
profile_positions.title: Software Developer / Technical Product Owner

profile_positions.description:
Including this biographical fact only for record purposes,
❌ I am not planning to look for Scrum Master job offers. 💼

I started to help our Scrum teams as a "Developer performing the role of Scrum Master" - learning more about this position and fulfilling my natural predisposition to organize things, facilitate team communication, and improve the work efficiency of our teams.
Later, responsible for supervising, training, and volunteering in other Scrum teams.
For a short period (about 1+ year), I was also Scrum Master in my private side-project "Proxima Majoris" while managing our 3D artists and Game Developers teams.
profile_positions.title: Software Developer / Scrum Master

profile_positions.description:
Backend .NET Core / C# Software Developer (OSS) at T-Mobile Netherlands B.V. (T-Mobile Thuis)
in Digital Orchestration (Diemen & The Hague, The Netherlands).

🏆 Company profile:
T-Mobile aka. "Magenta" is one of the largest Telecommunication Services companies on Earth and one of the most popular customer choices in Europe and the United States. Local (country-wise) departments of the company are independent entities, sharing mostly the logo with the mother brand. The largest branch is T-Mobile US. In Germany, the local branch of T-Mobile is known as Deutsche Telekom AG. Listed on NASDAQ, DAX, AEX, and more.

Responsibilities:
– Development of new features (delivery process, customer business area)
– Improving existing solutions by introducing new or upgrading old technologies
– Unit and integration tests
– Presenting team achievements during sprint demos
– Member of "Code Quality Guild" (clean code and architecture standards)
– Mentorship of junior software developers

Technologies:
– .NET Core (3+ and 5+), ASP.NET Core MVC, Entity Framework Core, T-SQL,
REST API, web applications, Swagger, LibMan, Refit, HTML, jQuery, JavaScript,
async programming, NUnit3 unit tests/integration tests, RegEx, LINQ to SQL;
– Cooperation: Git, GitLab, MS Teams, Jira, Miro;
– CI/CD: TeamCity, Octopus, Kibana
